article.title: SAIC to Support Air Traffic Control and Landing Systems
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Science Applications International Corporation, San Diego, California, is being awarded a $10 million contract modification to support system design, engineering, integration, installation, training, operational support, and in-service engineering for the Air Traffic Control and Landing Systems used by the U.S. Navy, Marine Corps, and other Department of Defense activities.Â The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, is the contracting activity.
